definition: to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback

sentences.english: This is what got me fired and then hired.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼我被炒掉了能夠又東山再起。

sentences.english: Part of getting better is to face the fears and sensations.
sentences.chinese: 部分患者再起作用下逐漸轉好，直面恐懼和情感。

sentences.english: He that falls today maybe up tomorrow again.
sentences.chinese: 今日跌倒的他或許他日還能東山再起。

sentences.english: I don't believe that it will be possible to put young Cowperwood on his feet after this.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信這回能夠使年輕的柯柏烏東山再起。

sentences.english: Al-Jadaa rebounded by selling her inventory and buying the equipment needed to start over.
sentences.chinese: 賈達通過變賣庫存重新購買設備才得以東山再起。

sentences.english: The peace talks broke down completely, and the two opposing parties took up arms again.
sentences.chinese: 和平會談徹底破裂，對立雙方再起干戈。

sentences.english: After years of semi-retirement, the actressstaged a comeback.
sentences.chinese: 那位女明星在數年的半退休之後東山再起。

sentences.english: The boss lost all his money, but soon bobbed up again.
sentences.chinese: 這老闆完全虧了本，但很快東山再起。

sentences.english: If escaping from death, need equestrian desert, in the future good stage a comeback.
sentences.chinese: 大難不死的話，就需要騎馬逃跑，日後好東山再起。

sentences.english: It is difficult for Central and Southern Europe to resurge in the short term.
sentences.chinese: 中東歐經濟短期內難以東山再起。

sentences.english: We suffered a terrible blow, but we are coming back.
sentences.chinese: 我們遭受了沉重一擊，但是我們正在東山再起。

sentences.english: At first the alarmists prophesied a renewal of the war.
sentences.chinese: 起初，有一些危言聳聽的人預言戰爭會重新再起。

sentences.english: The boxer hopes to stage a come-back.
sentences.chinese: 這拳擊家希望東山再起。

sentences.english: But I fear there is to see her again so that their hearts agitatedly.
sentences.chinese: 可是我有害怕見到她讓自己的心再起勃然。

sentences.english: They didn't admit they were defeated; they began to recruit and attempted to stage a comeback.
sentences.chinese: 他們不承認失敗，他們開始招兵妄圖東山再起。

definition: to spring up everywhere/from all around
continuously arising/to arise repeatedly
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
to counterattack/a counteroffensive
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
unrest (social or political)/turmoil/upheaval/commotion
could happen at any moment/on the verge
weapons/arms/fighting/war
once more/once again/one more time
endlessly/ceaselessly
to lift (a lid)/to rock/to convulse
to provoke/to stir up/to incite
lit. to return in a swirl of dust (idiom)/fig. to regroup and come back even stronger/to make a comeback
to seize the opportunity/to strike while the iron is hot
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
